extensionName.description: Please keep in mind that these strings had to be approved by the Google Brand Features Team. Be sure to make clear that this extension is *FOR* Google Calendar and not *BY* Google. Also, it was explicitly stated, that the phrase 'Google Calendar' should be localized just as it is on the localized versions of the Google Calendar UI.

extensionDescription.message: Allows bidirectional access to Google Calendar
extensionDescription.description: Please keep in mind that these strings had to be approved by the Google Brand Features Team. Be sure to make clear that this extension is *FOR* Google Calendar and not *BY* Google. Also, it was explicitly stated, that the phrase 'Google Calendar' should be localized just as it is on the localized versions of the Google Calendar UI.

gdata-provider.label.description: Please keep in mind that these strings had to be approved by the Google Brand Features Team. Be sure to make clear that this extension is *FOR* Google Calendar and not *BY* Google. Also, it was explicitly stated, that the phrase 'Google Calendar' should be localized just as it is on the localized versions of the Google Calendar UI.

gdata.migration.description.message: The Provider for Google Calendar has detected that you have existing calendars that are only capable of accessing Google Calendar in read-only mode. If you would like to upgrade any of these calendars, please select them below.

gdata.wizard.session.description.message: Please pick an existing session or enter your email address to create a new session. You only need one session per account.

gdata.wizard.calendars.description.message: Please select the calendars and task lists you would like to subscribe to.

gdata.wizard.nextstep.description.message: Please advance to the next step to set up your calendars.

busyTitle.description: Events with only free/busy access don't have a title, they will use this title instead. The calendar name is used as a parameter, since its often named after the person whose calendar you are viewing.

calendar_name.example: The name of the calendar, e.g. 'Home'

quotaExceeded.message: The quota for $session_id$ has been exceeded, please try again later.
quotaExceeded.description: This is shown when the request quota has been exceeded.

session_id.example: The session id (what the user enters as an email in the new calendar dialog)

providerOutdated.message: This version of the provider has expired, please update to the latest version.

errors.rate_limit_exceeded.message: A lot of users are logging in right now, Google has indicated that the login quota has been exceeded. Please try again later.
errors.rate_limit_exceeded.description: This is shown when the login quota has been exceeded (globally).

reminderOutOfRange.message: Google Calendar only allows reminders up to 4 weeks before the event starts.

calendar_name.example: The name of the calendar, e.g. 'Home'

num_events_synced.example: The number of events already synced

calendar_name.example: The name of the calendar, e.g. 'Home'

num_tasks_synced.example: The number of tasks already synced

calendar_name.example: The name of the calendar, e.g. 'Home'

requestWindowDescription.message: The Provider for Google Calendar would like to access your account $session_id$ to retrieve events and tasks. Credentials and calendaring data is only transferred between your computer and Google, no third party sites are involved.

session_id.example: The session id (what the user enters as an email in the new calendar dialog)
The session id (what the user enters as an email in the new calendar dialog)

settings.warning.message: These settings will allow you to make use of email scheduling via Google Calendar, but there have also been reports about extraneous notification emails being sent. Please test with a small meeting first.

settings.sendEventNotifications.message: Send email notifications to event guests

settings.forcePlainText.message: Force use of plain text in event descriptions

onboarding.welcome.p1.message: The Provider for Google Calendar marked the beginning of my journey into open source. Back in 2006, there was no easy way to connect Thunderbird with Google Calendar. Driven by curiosity and a desire to help, I explored Google's APIs and found a way to bridge that gap, enabling countless Thunderbird users to access Google Calendar. That experience not only gave me a sense of purpose but also opened doors to a professional career where open source has become an integral part of my daily life.
onboarding.welcome.p1.description: This is the beginning of a set of strings that make up the onboarding experience. Please prioritize the other strings first before you get to these

onboarding.welcome.p2.message: You are now a part of this journey with me. Your support means a lot to me, and I can't imagine a future without this add-on.

onboarding.welcome.p3.prelink.message: Before you skip reading this page, please check the
onboarding.welcome.p3.prelink.description: In this paragraph, there is a link embedded. There is a prelink, linktext and postlink string you can use to fill the whole sentence. Be sure to add appropriate spaces.

onboarding.welcome.p3.postlink.message: to make the right choice on how attendees appear in events and how invitations are handled.

onboarding.getstarted.imgalt.message: The sidebar in Thunderbird's calendar view with the new calendar button at the bottom
onboarding.getstarted.imgalt.description: This is the accessibility alt text for the image of the Getting Started section

onboarding.getstarted.p1.message: Not sure where to start? You need to subscribe to your calendars first. Head over to the calendar tab in Thunderbird and click "New Calendar" at the bottom of the sidebar.

onboarding.providertype.imgalt.message: New calendar dialog, showing the option to select Google Calendar
onboarding.providertype.imgalt.description: This is the accessibility alt text for the image of the On the Network section

onboarding.providertype.p1.message: You will see three options: On my computer, On the network, and Provider for Google Calendar. Although Google Calendar is technically on the network, select the provider-specific option.

onboarding.providertype.p2.message: On the next screen, enter your email address. Even if you're subscribing to someone else's calendar, use your own email. If you've already subscribed to their calendar on the Google Calendar website, it will appear within your account.

onboarding.selectcalendars.imgalt.message: A list of calendars with checkboxes to the side
onboarding.selectcalendars.imgalt.description: This is the accessibility alt text for the image of the Select Calendars section

onboarding.selectcalendars.p1.message: Next, you will be prompted to log in. The login dialog will specify the email address to use, so make sure you are signing into the correct account. If you are asked to log in again at a later time, ensure you use the indicated account.

onboarding.selectcalendars.p2.message: On the following screen, select the calendars and task lists you want to subscribe to. Previously subscribed calendars will appear as already added. To unsubscribe, use the context menu in Thunderbird's calendar list instead of the new calendar dialog.

onboarding.allset.imgalt.message: The new task dialog, showing only the fields relevant to the dialog
onboarding.allset.imgalt.description: This is the accessibility alt text for the image of the You're All Set section

onboarding.allset.p1.message: That's it. The initial synchronization may take some time, especially if you have many events. Thunderbird might appear frozen during this process due to how it handles events. Let it run for up to half an hour before assuming there is an issue. In most cases however, synchronization completes within a minute.

onboarding.allset.p2.message: What's next? Time to schedule some events. One advantage of using the Provider for Google Calendar instead of the built-in CalDAV connection is the additional customization available in the event dialog. You can set default alarms and adjust default privacy settings. Additionally, you can manage Google Tasks directly in Thunderbird.

onboarding.scheduling.p1.message: Scheduling between Thunderbird and Google can be tricky. Thunderbird does not always provide clear information about whether an event is an accepted invitation or a new event. Here are a few settings to consider:

onboarding.scheduling.enableEmailInvitat.message: This allows you to accept invitations using the bar above the email invitation message. While convenient, it is generally better to keep this off and instead rely on the "Automatically add events to your calendar" setting in Google Calendar's web settings.

onboarding.scheduling.sendEventNotificat.message: When enabled, Google sends notifications when you change an event. If disabled, it functions like clicking "Don't Send" every time you update a scheduled event.

onboarding.scheduling.enableAttendees.message: If you have events with attendees, you will likely want this enabled. Without it, any changes you make to an event will remove all attendees. If you change this setting, be sure to re-subscribe to your calendars.

onboarding.scheduling.p2.message: If email scheduling is enabled and something goes wrong, Thunderbird may create a new event instead of properly accepting an existing one. For large meetings, such as an all-company event, this could make it seem like you are inviting everyone to a duplicate event.

onboarding.scheduling.p3.prelink.message: If you want to change these settings later on, go to the
onboarding.scheduling.p3.prelink.description: In this paragraph, there is a link embedded. There is a prelink, linktext and postlink string you can use to fill the whole sentence. Be sure to add appropriate spaces.

onboarding.weblate.imgalt.message: Screenshot of weblate, translating a string from English to German
onboarding.weblate.imgalt.description: This is the accessibility alt text for the image of the This Content in your Language section

onboarding.weblate.p1.message: The Provider for Google Calendar uses Weblate for translations, where you can easily translate strings into your language. Do you speak a non-English language and want to help?

onboarding.weblate.p2.prelink.description: In this paragraph, there is a link embedded. There is a prelink, linktext and postlink string you can use to fill the whole sentence. Be sure to add appropriate spaces.

onboarding.weblate.p2.postlink.message: today! Can you get your language to 100%?

onboarding.footer.p1.prelink.message: If you have any questions, please reach out via the add-on's
onboarding.footer.p1.prelink.description: In this paragraph, there is a link embedded. There is a prelink, linktext and postlink string you can use to fill the whole sentence. Be sure to add appropriate spaces.

onboarding.footer.p1.postlink.message: . This is also where you can help improve future versions of the add-on.

onboarding.footer.p2.message: Thanks for reading all the way to the end! If you've made it this far, I hope you're as excited about this add-on as I am. Go ahead and give it a try first, but if you are already sold I'd appreciate your support.

onboarding.footer.donate.text.message: Send me a token of appreciation

onboarding.donate.amount.description: The rough equivalent of 15 Euros in your language's native currency, rounded up to a round number. This needs to be in the format that works for a the paypal.me link, it will be expanded to e.g. "https://paypal.me/kewisch/15eur"
